Okay, so the gameplay here is what you expect. You pick a dinosaur from a list of six dinosaurs (currently), and it plops you in the world with a ghostly UI of a food and water meter. You drink and eat simply by pressing E" on the respective source. Now

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Short review:

Gameplay/Animations/Models/Graphics: Amazing

Devs: Extremely hardworking, can be snappy

Community: Cancer

Extensive review:

As it is now, The Isle is a multiplayer open world sandbox game in its very bare-bones state. When finished, it will be a hardcore survival including humans (tribals, cannibals, mercenaries) and a complex progression system that I will not go into because no one is 100% sure how it will work.

The graphics are stunning if you have a PC that can handle the game with full settings. If not, the game is not optimized well, so you will probably be stuck with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ graphics or getting a refund. The animations and models are the most realistic of any dinosaur game, excluding stegosaurus and anklyosaurus' animations for attacking...

The developers are the most hardworking and persistent in a game, especially an indie game with a small team, that I have ever seen. They can be snappy at moments, but for good reason if you read below.

The community is complete and utter cancer, with a few exceptions. I have never seen a more ungrateful, needy group of people. The devs work their asses off to release updates almost daily and most comments on the patch notes are kids saying, WHERE IS THE QUETZAL" "GIVE US THE QUETZAL YOU GUYS LIED TO US." Not to mention the lack of people in the community who read the pinned threads of the discussion page and end up suggesting dinosaurs/mechanics that are already confirmed for the game or asking for ETA's. I've even seen threads of people asking the devs to make a dinosaur before a certain date. It would be one thing if there was just a couple threads doing this
date: but the discussions page is literally bombarded with people asking for ETA's/Dinosaurs/Bug fixes that are already known.\n\nOverall
recommended: The Isle is a very enjoyable game that has a lot of potential with diligent devs who don't half-♥♥♥ anything. I'm extremely excited to see where this game goes.\n\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Isle has a certain quality and sheen to it that other games, especially indie games, do not usually have.  It may be the Unreal 4 engine, the well-done models and animations, the sound effects, skins, etc, but the game doesn't feel cheap or crappy.  Everything is solid, substantial, and meaningful.  While currently not a finished product, the game feels like taking the wheel behind an expensive car as it passes through an assembly line.  Everything just feels good, nice, of high quality, and I have no reason to doubt this trend will continue as updates push out frequently.

The Isle as it stands right now is an open sandbox dinosaur environment with survival mechanics on the side.  You simply select the dinosaur you wish to play from a menu and spawn in an open map.  Your goals are what you make them to be.  You must immediately search for food and water, but death has no true cost yet.  Your activities are entirely player created.  I spend most of my time hunting and killing other players, and find the games current combat mechanics to be simple, yet enjoyable and fun to try and master.

The game will transform as time goes on, becoming more focused on a survival experience rather than just a sandbox with no real game-based goals.  The ideas the devs have shared regarding the direction they wish to bring the game, however, looks fantastic.  There are all kinds of amazing concepts and stuff they are planning to add that I can't wait to see.  Also, though I love the open sandbox, I also love the thrill of trying to survive.  Some of my best times in this game have been when I'm on the brink of death searching desperately for a corpse to feed off.  I expect as the game continues development, more of these moments will be had, and more frequently.

I personally have no issues with any of the devs of this game, though I see much discussion on this topic from others.  If you’re really that concerned about offensive devs, don’t join discord and steer clear of the forums where they post frequently.  It’s that simple.

The same goes for the community.  I’ve made a lot of friends on this game, and most the people I talk to are friendly and cool people, both in-game and on the forums.

I think this game’s going to make it to something great, and I encourage you to hop on for the ride there.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ignoring what the game promises in the future, the current content is simple.

You can play as a dinosaur, move around, look for appropriate food and attack/defend against others.

In one play session I got 2 stories, both a lot of fun.

As a T-Rex I managed to non verbally convince a Carno and Raptor that I didn't consider them food (the raptor was hard, being skittish) we formed a pack and protected a territory for at least a half hour. Without saying anything.
It was great :D -Until I died :)

After exploring more Dinosaur options I settled onto a Galli.
Soon after spawning I ran into a Puertasaurus.
After trying out a Puertasaurus I knew that being one is lonely, due to it's slow speed.
It was also under  attack from a raptor. I ran in attacked the raptor and we scared it off.
The 2 of us then proceeded to wander the map for over an hour.
After 40 minutes of us gesturing with our calls to indicate predators, mountain passes etc.. he typed for the first time in global chat. Just to say he appreciated my company.

At the moment this is a quiet game with brief moments of terror.
But the social aspect is different from any I've played before.
There is a global chat in-game. But despite a few people always talking, it's amazing how many simply communicate using body language.

With the addition of factions, humans etc later this may change. But at the moment you can either play with a dinosaur. Or you can play AS a dinosaur.

10/10
Would wander amlessly with a silent friend again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*Spawned near a carno, rex, and an allo as an anky.*

*They were suprisingly peaceful.*

*The trex jumped off a small rock and broke his leg.*

*He limped next to me, asking for me to kill him.*

*I killed him, and saw his body get eaten by the carno and allo.*

*We then went on an adventure to find Twins.*

*We traveled a long way, and heard other dinos around, we avoided them.*

*We took a rest on a small hill*

*A few seconds later, the carno left the game.*

*Me and Allo became best friends.*

*We were close to Spawn Lake.*

*We got there, and I ate and drank, he did the same too.*

*He then typed in 'suicide' into the console.*

*I spammed 4 in sadness, sat next to him, heartbroken.*

*I heard a pachy.*

*Pachy went to the lake and took a drink.*

*The Allos body disappeared, before he did, I took a screenshot.*

*Pachy realized why I was spamming 4, he went up to me, and tried to cheer me up.*

*Next second later, I found out the server reset.*

11/10 Would cry again to a dead dinosaur in a video game.

Hey, Allo player, if you see this review, make sure to friend me. :) You're a good pal.

R.I.P all the dinosaurs that were in our adventure. You will be missed.

(EDIT) Go to my profile, and you will see a picture of the dead allosaurus.

#RIPMYBESTIEALLO Spread the word! <3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is pretty fun, but the community is horrible!
The latest patch brought a lot of bugs into the game because they changed the public build into the test build. They still left a copy of the stable build for you to play though, but didnt leave a guide on how to do so and they didnt host a 'Legacy' server so people could play on the stable build. So I did. *edit* actually they didnt explain what was going on in depth very well at all...
This resulted in me getting banned. Even with the expressed permission of one of the devs to make information about my/the only legacy server available...
The mods and the devs need to communicate more, them punishing me and not helping me get the information out about the legacy build lead a lot of people to believe I was spamming and advertising (which got me banned on actual game servers) when really I was posting a fix. The fix: The server I paid $90 to host because they and no one else had and a guide on how to change your build and what the build really was. Read the thread yourself.
http://steamcommunity.com/app/376210/discussions/7/364040166677550022/

*edit* My spamming was actually: Me selectively reading and posting on threads that were asking for help with the new patch, complaining about the new patch, or just not digging being on the test build whatsoever. I was not posting the guide onto every new thread that popped up. Only threads that were relevant to the fix that being on the Legacy brought. This could have been avoided if the mods/devs would have pinned a guide like they said they would and hosted a server so people could actually play on the Legacy build. Instead they left it up to the player base to do so and then punished said players for showing others that it even existed. It has yet to be pinned in the general discussion with an in depth description as to what the heck is going on...

As for the game: The game is really fun in the Legacy (stable) build. Very addicting.
But I wouldnt even try playing on the Public build anymore... It is riddled with bugs and crashes.

Pros: fun game, though I found myself turning off the chat and playing solo more than grouping up with people...
Foilage! All the vegetation makes the maps look alive. Some places are so dense with trees and bushes you can literally become invisible while crouching in them with some of the dinos. This makes for some really fun tactical gameplay, esp if your positioned on a spawn migration route towards water.
A major sense of realism- takes a while to get used to. These arent HollyWood Dinos :P
Models! All the Dinosaur models look stunning and are incredibly fun to experience!
Stability! While playing on the Legacy build of the game, it runs suprisingly smooth and doesnt crash often if ever.

Cons: Buggy and has a lot of crashes while playing on Public build.
Horrible community - reason for turning off chat while playing and the devs/mods have no customer support skills whatsoever/get on major power trips. This overall decided my rating with the game. I've never supported something when I didn't like who was producing it. I felt truly insulted by PunchPacket and the community as a whole when trying to make information available.


Edit* Read the comments of this review for more on the terrible customer support.
Starts on Page 5 of the comments. Yes, five pages of being talked down to and argued with...
As someone who paid for this game and was chased away by the Devs/Mods, I simply cannot suggest that anyone buy this game. This will likely be your experience with the Devs/Mods, as is expressed in many other reviews about the game. You WILL be treated poorly by this team. They do not deserve to make money for the evidently atrocious and offensive customer support they offer...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before you complain about the price being too high for EA, first look at Overgrowth, which is in early access since more than 5 years, there's nothing else to do than fight against a computer, and it costs 30 euros.

The game has awesome graphics and dinosaur models. Although it's still in early access, it is very fun to play, and it seems that it's going to get even better!
I don't recommend buying this game if you're not sure that your computer will handle it. It just makes it less fun, trust me xD

Pros:
- really good Graphics
- cool animations
- no need to buy skins (they removed them for now though)
- species chat, which allows carnivores to plan attacks on herbivores
- realistic maps
- realistic dino voices
- raptor pounce/latch
- hunting and survival

Cons:
- Low amount of dinosaurs (atm, there's going to be even more!)
- If you hunt with someone, there's a big chance that you will be biting eachother while attacking something
- No sense of smell (atm)
- No way of telling what is where if you don't know the coording system or have poor memory, for you can remember where to go by remembering the terrain.

guess that's all.

So, I totally recommend buying the game if you like dinosaurs, hunting and survival. If the price is really so big of an issue to you, then I recommend waiting for some promotion.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I very much wish I could give this game a positive review. It has a lot of potential. Sadly, there is a reason ARK: Survival Evolved just added 200 new XBone servers, and The Isle barely manages to keep one, perhaps 2 servers at peak hours (capped at 75 and 50 players respectively) full.

My review of the game and it's content will be down below, though I can sum it up by saying, the game as it stands is not worth the price unless you're an extreme dinosaur enthusiast who isn't satisfied with ARK, The Hunter Primal, or pretty much... any other Dinosaur game. As I hear it, ARK has a mod that allows you to play as dinosaurs now. And it has a better world map, and lots more gameplay and dinosaur species to offer as well. So unless you're absolutely desperate, I say look elsewhere.

First, I'd like to start off by reviewing what is single handedly the biggest problem of the game.

The Dev Team and the Community.

I wish someone had told me about all of this before I purchased the game... Hopefully someone will find this review helpful, and morally object to supporting these kinds of people. If I can deter at least one potential buyer, I've done my job. ((*note* A couple choice pieces of info will be info I gleaned from other negative reviews and not something I experienced personally.))

The devs are extremely rude and openly admit to being trolls, with great pride no less! They openly mock, ridicule, and attack their community... you know, the people who spent their hard earned money on a very rough early access game. To support their idea. And I don't just mean attack in game. I mean both on their forums and during their live streams.

They openly make fun of players who have physical and mental disabilities (especially autism) and casually use words like the F word for gay people, and it seems like they even use the N word for black people. I myself saw Dondi say something to the effect of Nignag" in Tyrranosaur species chat during a live stream. There was no one on the server at the time with such a steam name. So I think I can safely put 2 + 2 together here and figure out what kind of person he is

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had a rather sad moment in the game. I was a Dryo who broke it's leg jumping over a dip on the ground and tried to keep up with the herd, while two stayed behind to watch over me. A Maia and a Galli. But then a Rex came over to attack, killing the Galli and chasing off the Maia, leaving me alone.

I limped alone around the Misty Valley map in the night, broadcast calling, serching for my herd... And then found the body of the dead Rex. Exited that I might be close, I called and called but got no response... A little further down into the lowlands, I then found my herd, but they was all dead, likely from bleed damage due to the Rex they tried to fight or another pred ambushing them aftwewards while they were weak.

I then laid besides my herd and did a broadcast call of sadness, mourning my herd... And then was found and adopted by a raptor that was nearby and became part of their pack.

10/10, would get emotional again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Isle is a fun new dinosaur survival game that is turning out to be quite AMAZING. I did not expect to have this much fun with such a simple game. The current game play is your typical survival game, except you're a dinosaur and you just run, eat, and fight. If that sounds boring to you, then you do not appreciate the thrill of hunting in a pack of raptors, or the terror of being stalked through the woods by carnivores.

The incoming features and dinosaurs will make this game absolutely delicious, and I foresee myself logging several hundred more hours of time on this game. Check out my YouTube channel for more details.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had fun initially, but with the recent drama coming up (the Devs being unwilling to pay an artist that worked on their game, despite the work being done already) and the fact that the Dev uses some derogatory terms to describe an artist that poured hours upon hours daily into the game, I cannot recommend it.

Irresponsible devs, untrustworthy devs, it's just not something I wanna support. If I could get a refund, I certainly would without hesitation. Instead, I have to settle for warning other users that this Dev may not ever deliver the game if they can't even pay their artist.

EDIT: News of a turnaround happening reached me after work this morning (Feb 9th). I would advise anyone to keep an eye on the matter, forums and on Steam, and see if things change for the better or whatever other news might turn up.

EDIT THE SECOND: Not concerning Devs, but I can't possibly support the sort of behavior that is outright PROMOTED within the discussions either. And this time I do have proof to supply that should remain for a long time:

http://puu.sh/n337M/82f200acd2.png <-- this opening post is in direct violation of Steam's Discussion Rules and Guidelines. Several users are called idiots in the OP, and comments within encourage harassing these users in-game. This topic has been reported numerous times, but has only been locked (it should be removed entirely).

As if that wasn't disgusting enough, we have two screenshots of a MODERATOR, a person who is there to uphold the community and discussion rules and guidelines, saying the following:
http://puu.sh/n3396/7da633450b.png
http://puu.sh/n33ak/623b64ef64.png

Look at those posts and you tell me if you genuinely believe this is a community you want to play with, much less support? The moderator promoted the harassment, name-calling, and the bullying of these users. That is not what a moderator should be doing in any capacity, and further this moderator actually promotes public shaming. This is genuinely disgusting to me.

I'll keep updating my review as more ♥♥♥♥ hits the fan.

EDIT THE THIRD: The artist is working with the Devs again, so my first misgivings can be ignored for the time being. Of course, this opens a whole new can of worms, but with nothing to go on, it isn't worth really discussing that at this time.

The moderator nonsense, however, is still a fun topic.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Now, normally I play as the Albino Rex in this game, but tonight I felt a little squirrely and decided to be a little strawberry colored Dryosaurus. I spawn in, take a look around at where I am, and realize a Carno spawns in on top of me. I croon at him thinking I can get away with not being eaten, but soon enough he's chasing me.

I bolt for the nearest lake while screaming for help in my adorable little dryo squeaking voice. Bobbing and weaving among the trees hoping to throw off the carno, until ultimately I get chomped when I run out of trees.

10/10 would Dryo Squeak for my life again. :D

_______________________________

As for the real review, this game being in its initial stages is already freaking awesome. I've had the privelage to watch the streams the dev puts up, along with interacting and reporting my own share of bugs and such to contribute to helping this game improve in all areas. I'm always excited for what patch is coming next as there's always something new being rolled out.

Especially with the frequency by which this game is updated, seemingly every week to almost every day! there's always something to look forward too, and it shows there's a huge amount of dedication being put into this game. There are some salty people reviewing this game as bad just to be jerks because they don't like the creator, but the way I look at it, you came to play this game to play the game, not have philisophical discussions with the dev. If you don't like him, don't talk to him. o_O

I've played this game for what is it, 120.5hrs already? (yeesh), and I've come to understand Dondi's brand of humor and sure it might not be for everyone, but I can appreciate the morbidity of it and the fact that he doesn't get swayed by hateful rhetoric from salty people who've only put in 20 minutes into the game or what have you.

I personally have enjoyed the hell out of watching Dondi's stream as well as Bryan and Bikeman's, etc. I've laughed until I've cried from how funny watching the Stegosaurus being rigged was that one evening. I'm sure everyone that was present that night had sore sides from how hard we all were laughing, and it's moments like that that really show to me this game is a labor of love and not just in it for the money.

Being able to see the game THIS early is a privelage I feel, since some games don't even roll out this early on, but because of this I get to see some insight on how the game is created, I get to ask the devs how things work, how they made a map or a dino, or a skin, etc. You can't say that about every game out there!

I highly encourage you to get this game now, especially for the price it's at, and there's already a growing community and the fact that it's being updated SO frequently makes it almost like opening a Christmas gift every time.

Don't pay attention to the ones complaining about this or that, play the game for yourself and let your own experiences decide for you how you choose to play.  I personally like to scavenge as a Rex, since I'm a lazy ♥♥♥♥, but I do hunt and will defend my pack, etc when it's needed. It's a lot of fun and I've sunk in a lot of hours already with more to come.

This is a great survival game set in the time of dinosaurs with a lot of respect paid to the dino models and the environment. Eventually there will be humans and cannibals, and more dinos, so definitely get this game! There's a lot planned for it! :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS REVIEW AND WILL BE UPDATED ONCE FULLY RELEASED
Playing this game obviously has a lot of bugs. Both funny and annoying but not game breaking. I enjoy the survival aspect of the game and it is a pleasant experience running around for 15-30 minutes scavaging for food to either finally make a kill, find a corpse or even another player. The maps are very huge so even in high populated servers of 50+ players it will take you a while before encountering them either because they're stealthy or spread out in packs or herds.

So far, I'm enjoying this game as it develops, and if you're a true Dinosaur lover and like a semi-realistic survival simulation then this is for you. Just remember that  this is an Early Access game that is not fully developed so keep an open mind if you purchase this game. Also please do research on what this game stands for. This is not a Deathmatch game, this is Survival, and is pretty difficult in some ways to to survive as both Predator and Herbavore in this game at times.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who enjoys The Forest, or any other survival games - as this is what this will be. Not a prehistoric feral heart, but a decent survival game in which death is around every corner, humans will be added, along with the ferocious cannibals.

This game shows promise, and will become my favorite game once everything planned has been added. The mesh work, the texturing, shaders, flora, and sounds, they're all superb, and will improve. Overall at it's current state, it still manages to be fun, but it will change into a better game; Dondi and the other hard-working developers will make sure of that.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game the day it came out, literally I watched the stream the night prior and the next day it was out.

Since then the game has made unbelievable progress for the holidays and a very small team of people to develop it. We've seen the adding and updating of a more player friendly map called Reigon 1. We've seen the Therzino being added (and quickly nerfed) to the game. The Puerta had its eating and attack system overhauled even before Therzino came out.

Now we're entering 2016- boy what a time to be alive for this game. In these first two months alone we're looking to see 2 systems for players being added. Progression, groups, and spawning/logging out. These will be vital to the base of the game, we have a volunteer modeler who is developing our best models for the progression/spawning system. Great guy.

To the game though. The game itself, it is bare bones. Yes, all you can currently do is run and eat. But species chat is in, so you only talk to players using the same dinosaur as you. Making stalking, migrating, and hunting all the more tense. The game can set you on edge, if you're a herd of Shantungosaurus' and a Rex pack of 8 shows up behind and in front of you. You'll want to run, but your trapped. Moments like this are wonderful.

The game won't hand you a thing to do, no build a home and a tame a dinosaur" or "go rescue bully because he didn't run now he's Rex kibble". You're goal is to survive and the tasks that come  with it to ensure yourself a higher chance of survival.

Also
date:
lets get a few things straight.

1) Shanty is twice the weight and size of Rex- it should by all means be able to 1hko you. Granted it comes at a huge cost for the shanty.

2) The game is EA it is being developed- at a terrifying rate too. If you wish to support the devs buy the game. If you wish to wait and still support
recommended: buy the game later. It's shaping up to be a real gem."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: 2-26-16 Patch: 0.72

Graphics: 8/10
When I first watched the trailer for this game, I was blown away. The graphics are simply breath-taking and I couldn't wait to get this game.

Too bad my computer can't display the high graphics. Still looks pretty good with everything on low.


Dinosaurs: 5/10 7/10 UPDATE
The dino's are lovely and most of them run pretty smooth. My main problem is the recent stat nerf. It's makes the game much harder for novice players like myself to hunt and find food. (I've even seen more senior members complain that it's much harder)

I do kinda like the fact that you start out with low hunger and thirst, because it gives you a sense of urgency to hunt. But when you're a raptor and you need to find a pack quickly to successfully hunt, you have to sometimes run clear across the map to get there. With the stat nerf, it takes forever (even when sprinting 70% of the time) to get to a pack and you're near dead by the time you get there. (If something hasn't gotten you first.)

EDIT: Now you start out with 50% hunger/thirst, and more stamina. +2


Community: 7/10 6/10 UPDATE
Community is kinda meh. Most people on the forums are pretty ok from what I've seen. When in game, though, it is highly recommended to stay with you're own species if you're a carnivore. Herbivores should either stick with their own kind or form small herds with other herbies. Or you can always form an 'oddball' pack with friends that you can communicate with via steam chat.

EDIT: Community is kinda going downhill, in between players calling you carebear at every turn and many being insanely aggressive. Rather amusing to watch a herd of 5+ Shantu go out of their way to chase after 1 raptor that was merely trying to get to the forest behind them. -1

Developers: 2/10 3/10 UPDATE
Now to the main thing that inspired me to make a review.

The developers of the game are extremely rude and don't seem professional at all. Attending their streams proves that. They call their players idiots, losers, etc. They've even gone as far as to call some of the community 'cancerous'. If you say something about this, you are mocked.
It really makes one feel like that the devs don't care about our opinions and just wanted us for the money.

Still, have to give them props for making a pretty good game.

EDIT: The questions thread was a great addition. (And its actually going well) +1


Despite all this, I still have some faith that this game can be great, but if I knew what I know now, I probably would have saved my money.

Of course this is all merely my point of view, take it with a grain of salt. If you still think buying it is worth it, then go ahead. I'm not stopping you, just informing you.

(Will be keeping this review up to date for the most part)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've only had this game for a few days and I've gotta say, it's really a lot of fun. The models are great, the animations for the most part are smooth. This game already has a lot of cool content including quite a few different dinos to play as, Packs, variety of calls ranging from friendly to aggressive to even injured. I was enjoying my time playing the game until the other day. The game was stable and you could play for hours with your friends. Now, because the Devs got tired of people whining about wanting updates they've gone and slapped us with the Dev branch of the game. This is a good chance to help the devs find bugs and fix issues but the major problem with this is the servers are now about as stable as a drunk trying to walk in a straight line. There are server wide crashes every 10-15 mins with no save methods so you get plopped down at a random spawn upon logging back in. As far as I've been able to find the Devs have pretty much told the player base to deal with it. Sure, you can fix the game and go back to a previous load but that requires to you reinstall the game to do it. There will also only be about 3-4 other players to play with at a time. All in all, it's a fun game with great potential but until servers become stable and the Devs don't snap at their playerbase for asking for news when news is hard to find I wouldn't recommend this game. I'd recommend coming back a few months from now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With the amount of time I put into The Isle, I feel it's time I left a review.
This may be a wee bit long, so I've put a TL;DR at the top of this.

TL;DRDO NOT purchase this game if ...
You do not like waiting for things to be released.
You do not like game breaking glitches.
You do not like not knowing everything that may come in the future.
You dislike non-feathered dinosaurs.
You dislike movie-monster like concepts, and scary alien people that will eat your feet.
You are easily triggered by movement sickness.
You expect a full game, despite purchasing an EA.
You do not like blunt responses given by the developers, despite them answering the same question day after day.
DO purchase this game if ...
You enjoy watching a product be developed.
You can give constructive feed back to game breaking issues.
You are fine with giant, scary, movie-monsters.
You enjoy that there will be creepy alien people that want to eat your feet.
You are okay with humans being in the game.
You love all dinosaurs, feathers or no feathers.
You appreciate transparency given by game devs, and understand blunt responses with no sugar-coating.
You do not expect a full, amazing game from early access.
You understand that lag, desync, falling through the world, and other such glitches will happen and will be fixed.
Now that we're out of TL;DR land, I will begin with my paragraphs.

I bought The Isle in December 2015, it was actually a gift from my lovely boyfriend after I enthused to him about the fact that I could play as a dinosaur. Ever since I bought the game, I thoroughly enjoyed it. I made many friends over the game, and I got to watch development streams where what I could play in the future was being made from the ground up. In January I took a temporary hiatus as real life came into the way, and I returned some-time in Febuary \ Early March. I was immediately amazed by all that had been implemented since I last played, and I was super happy that the devs hadn't dropped the ball when it came to the game.

Be it hunting with a pack of friends in a voice chat, and being complete and utter rebels; or even taking a night to play as one of my favorite herbivores just eating trees and bushes. The game, even if you are alone, has never been boring to me. (My proudest moment was back with the old Emerald rex skin, jumping a Diablo in Region 2 I do believe, and killing it before it could hit me. Back then, the little buggers had just become a thing and were very scary little murder-potatoes.)

I've lead massive herds of triceratops, I've lead a conga-line of Shantungosaurus, and I've defended Puertasaurus from predators back when it was just a big, walking, stack of meat. I've been disappointed, I've been excited. Basically, the game has been a roller-coaster from the start, and it will probably still be one when it is truly finished.

I absolutely adore how dedicated the team is to the game. They are all lovely folk, albeit blunt to people that ask repetitive questions that a simple google search would answer. Deathly's twitter is amazing and relatable, Dondi makes valid points and will give you valid life lesson speeches with Sledge while streaming him working on dino-ragdolls. All in all, despite having flaws as all humans do, they are all dedicated to getting the game finished and having it be one of the best successes in the dinosaur genre. Due to this, I respect them all greatly.

I bought the game simply because I could chomp people as a carnivore, but I'm staying with this game purely because what they have planned is amazing, and I cannot wait to see it. Through the glitches such as Diabloceratops being the sonic of the ceratopsids, through the awkward moments of flying under the world while testing Quetzalcoatlus, through the amazing team coordination that can be found from players like Predatoria, CircleofLife, and many others.

If you want to be apart of a game that is rapidly developing and expanding to be something absolutely amazing, then buy The Isle.

In the future I plan on releasing my own skins once steam workshop has been implemented. This is a plan for a lot of artists in the community, be it those who are still learning digital art, to those that surpass me on every level. In this game, you will likely see some genuinely ground breaking mods in the future. I am purely expecting someone to turn all the dinosaurs into dragons at some point.

Though for the vanilla game in whole, I am super excited to see what happens.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has immense potential. It is fun for the explorers in all of us to wander around trying to sustain oneself. The people are generally very interesting to interact with, or at the very least pester. I don't know why people complain about optimization, I run the game on ultra everything and I don't get any lag whatsoever.

CONTROLS
W A S D for Movement (rather standard)
F for roaring
Shift for running
E to eat or drink water (Carnivores eat carcasses, Herbivores eat really large ferns/bushy conifer)
Left click is for basic attack (bite or kick)
Right click for secondary attack
Ctrl for crouching (and stealth) (Puertas, Shantungasauruses and Therizinosaurus cannot crouch)
J to switch between quadrupedal and bipedal walking as Shantungosaurus
Enter to open up chat.
Insert to see general stats (health, stamina, coordinates, etc.)
Z to trot (to walk faster without losing stamina)
H to rest (to more rapidly regen stamina, immobilizing oneself and going prone)

Tips for those who wish to go into the game:
1:Puertasauruses eat large, darker trees.
2:Smaller herbivores (not puertasaurus) eat the dark green bushes, large ferns, shrubs and saplings.
3:Water is water, just drink it whether it be salty or fresh.
4:NPCs can be killed but they don't seem to care. You can only begin to imagine the things they've seen.
5:Herbivores are often times just as bloodthirsty as carnivores.
6:The only way to switch species is to die or disconnect and reconnect. Good luck.
7:Quickly learn the squat dance of peace.(and remember that it isn't contractually binding)
8:Coordinates are a bit confusing at first glance but you'll get used to them. Only be concerned by numbers in the thousands or above and ignore the 3rd coordinate (it's height).
9:No, there is no in-game map of the game. ( http://www.findtheisle.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=7&t=568 here is a fan-made map of Region 1)
10:No one is obligated not to kill you.
11:The Mesa map is massive and has gone through severel changes, namely going into HD and losing a lot of its water. Still hard to find people without pathways and known landmarks.
12:The Region 1 map is good because it isn't HD, has migration paths to major water supplies and has limited amount of these watering holes to concentrate players.
13:Region 2 map is very pretty but, as of writing, lacks a lot of functionality. On the upside there are a variety of environments from forested regions, plains, mountaneous areas, even a little bit of badlands.
14:Most carcasses die standing up, so the eerie hellscape of the standing dead is a gift.
15:Check out the developer streams on www.twitch.tv/thedondi/profile . From what I have seen this game has great potential and this review will be continually updated as its mechanics are changed.
16:The only way to master a species is to try it
17:Rexes can turn on a dime
18:As an austroraptor leap and press right mouse button at the same time to attempt to latch onto your prey, hold right mouse button to attempt to harm them (though not necessary). Watch your stamina!
19: With the stamina changes be sure to conserve stamina
20:The new HUD is awesome because it shows us our stamina.
21: Keep yourself near full on your hunder and thirst meters to allow yourself to passively heal.
22: Know thy enemy.
23: Memorize the different calls of each species and be sure to utilize them appropriately.

I hope to see this game flourish in popularity and continue to be worked upon, it seems like it can be fantastic.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Isle could be chalked up as just another survival game in the common eye. However, looking deeper, you can see that this game has a lot of potential behind what it says. The sheer fact that I can play a dinosaur gives this game +2 points, but the lack of content in the game at the moment (As of New Years Day 2016) gives this game a bad reputation. However, since the game is in early access, and the developers are clear about this fact, and when I mean clear I mean VERY CLEAR,  That deserves them some respect.

So moving on to the review. The Isle's concept is quite interesting, im looking very forward to playing the game once more content is added. I enjoy the idea of choosing between Human and Dinosaur, and I believe the interaction between these two will be quite a show. If you like high tech gear, go for the Mercs. If your like me and like to play primitive, go Tribemens. And if your like 90% of the player base, you'll be going Dinosaur. The variety of animals to choose from, along with the mysterious lore behind the game, gives the player a reason to come back and play this game over and over.

The developers are trustworthy. If your a TSL veteren (Refering to anyone who played TSL, really) like me, then you'll understand how a untrustworthy developer can ruin a game so easy. However, Dondi (The developer) is a great guy, who updates the game regularly, and even pops up on the servers to chat. Seriously, Im not joking, he really does. The rest of the team is also great, I even saw that Aphro, who moderated the TSL forums, is in the dev team now. +5 Trust Points.

So in conclusion, I will state this very clearly for those of you who can't make up there mind: Buy this game only, and I mean ONLY, if your willing to lay down the money to watch this game develop, give feedback, and just enjoy the game in general. If we the playerbase don't contribute, this game will never flourish to what we want it to be. I shall give this game a postive review, because I do enjoy this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I happen to like butt munching.

10/10

Alright, jokes aside! The Isle is very much a work in progress. There are bugs, and it can be frustrating at times, but it is steadily being updated and progressing at a rather quick pace compared to most Early Access games.

For a game with dinosaurs, it is the best at this moment in time. The models are great! While not all of them a realistic they cater to the fans of realism and fiction. If you want to be a feathered Rex you can! Soon you can be a scaled Rex (young, sub-adult and adult!)! The same with the eventual addition of Utahraptor. There will be a realistic feathered version and a Jurassic Parkish one. And it is also super fun to take a break from all the butt munching to relax (but not entirely) as one of the many herbivores!

There is not much to do other than PvP right now and because of this the balancing of dinos can seem, well, unbalanced. That is because, in the future, there will a progression system implemented. Where you will start off as the weakest creature of the playstyle you want. Carnivore or herbivore. Which is the base of your tree that branches off into many species.

To get the current super carnivores (Rex/Carno) or super herbivores (Puerta/Trike/Galli/ Shantu) each that is the best at its lifestyle will not be quick or easy. It does say on the store page this game will be hardcore. However, for now, they are all easy to access which means everyone, and their mom is playing as them. In the future, it will not be this way.

Lastly, there will be playable human and human-ish races. Survivors, Mercenaries, Tribals and Cannibals! Each will have their own playstyle. Survivors will, well, have to survive. Mercenaries will be more FPS. They will be able to tame some small dinosaurs, get jeeps and helicopters. Tribals will be the tamers and be able to tame nearly every dinosaur on the island, even player controlled dinos!

In the end, I think this game, with so much versatility, is easily worth the price. However, if you can't stand bugs, do not have the patience to wait for fixes, and take things too personally both in the game and in the discussion I would HIGHLY recommend you wait to buy until the game is finished.

I would also recommend not buying this game if you do not meet minimum requirements (obviously), and you are under the age of 18. While the game is not rated at the moment, it IS a mature game.

Now if you pass all that and happen to like following the development of games and seeing how it grows I can easily recommend it for you!

I hope this helps you to decide on your purchase and I hope to meet you in The Isle!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amezing and the concept is nice i like it but at this stage it is still a gamble.

However, there is a nice mix of players and bots in this game making this game kind of unique in the way that if you are carnivore you dont neceessarly have to find and kill other players in this game.

That being said a big problem of the game is a lack of action, it resemble a lot to a walking simulator (and i have played Day z) I know that the devs are planning to add a lot of content such as new dinosaurs, but I feel like what this game really needs is better AI, more herds of NPC preys and packs of NPC predators. Imagine if you had packs of smart raptors trying to cunnigly hunt you down or 1 or 2 berserk T-Rexes chaching you. It would add stress to the game and keep you on your toes. In other words, the dev needs to focus on the gameplay right now to keep the player base stable because a running simulator gets old real fast.

Conclusion: I recommend this game because it has potential and i think that the devs will be faithfull to the community, but keep in mind that their is not much to do in the game so waiting might be wise.

Also adding flying and underwater dinosaures later one would be nice, but hard to balance and should be done after gameplay developpement.

Keep going devs, your concept is nice, you have potential. please PLEASE dont ♥♥♥♥ this up

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This came i have to say is one of the better early access games I've played along side ark. However I spotted some issues maybe the devs can help fix.

I'm only stating the issues in my opinion and it's not to cause any harm towards others nor is it a complaint. I have this in the suggestions box and have copied and pasted it here for all to see!

Here are my personal issues at hand with the game:

First Issue, is that at spawn we should have a minute invunerability or at least a speed boost when we spawn in because let me tell you how many crappy people love sitting at spawn and killing people just because they are there. In fact right when I spawn in I get killed instantly without second thought. I know the world was brutal back then but not that brutal.

Second issue I have. The map is waaaaay too big not to have a map or some way of telling what is what. I understand it's suppose to be a world of awesomeness and just go do it kind of thing but reading cords is very confusing for people like myself who are dyslexic. I'm the kind of dyslexic that had there words and numbers flip backward and can't flip them back. It's a very bad disorder so if you could please make it do we can hit like the m button for a translucent map or something that would be appreciative.

Third Issue I have. Why is it the carnivores can crouch and we herbi's can't! I get they are predators but sometimes we try to talk to other herbi's and our crouch button is missing so we have to guess who is who isn't attacking. Crouching is actually how we learned to communicate as carnivores to tell who is friendly and who is not too. The same should be for herbavores.

Forth Issue. I have stated this before and just to make sure it's covered again. There is just not enough Herbavores to go around these days to supply the carnivores with enough meat. In fact the maps are so large it's hard to find a player. The one day it took me two to three hours to find one player and they killed me as a shanti even though I was a harmless theri. Putting my grumpiness of that aside it still leads down to the biggest problem. You can still have pvp and have more ai's running about. Hell half the time if a rex spots another player they like the chase instead of a standing still ai. In fact what one could do is if the rex is near by and is heard the ai can simply start running making the rex think of ways to sneak up. I mean they have a crouch button for good reason as stated before.

Last and finally not least my last issue. There is no last issue! In fact the last is actually a compliment. I play ark survival. I love playing it and for some reason this game caught my attention. Now I know why. Unlike ark survival it's not as laggish and the art style is beautiful even on low settings. Best part is I can run this game on high settings and only lag a small bit. A game that is this well made and still allows me to play at least on medium is very well off in my book. Another thing the game actually doesn't crash on me what so ever which is nice since Ark for some reason still loves to do it. Very well done devs and your game! For Early Access this will be a game worth buying!

Anyone reading this I thank so much. I try not to make complaints or call names as it's being a bad sport if I do. Also i know very well this is a very very early access game which can cause problems. Which is why the devs were kind enough to all us to play on it even though they didn't have to. At times there are times I want to cuss in chat because of some of these issues. However, how much you want to bet I'll still be playing this game for days to come. I just hope others enjoy it as well even though it's simple as it tis. I recommend this game to dino and pvpers alike who just want to hang out and have a good time. Maybe even a dev or two to come say hello as we would love to have you around!

If I did anything wrong in this post let me know as this is only m yfirst time reviewing the game. I am dyslexic so reading things can sometimes get me in to trouble due to the fact I get confused. If i need to I will change or delete the post if it offends!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm gonna make this perfectly clear, this game is not for everyone, at least at the moment. There isn't much content, nor much to do, but what is here is absolutely brilliant. The six species we have at the moment are all beautifully modeled and animated, the move smoothly, with one minor exception I'll get into later, and they play fairly well. The only real issue I have is that the transition between quadruped and biped stances for Shantungosaurus are a bit to quick for my taste, given the size of the animal, but I can look past it as it's more of a nitpick than anything. There are clipping issues, and the hitboxes on some things seem abit off, but given the current state I'll let these slide for the time being

The servers I will admit are somewhat problematic and prone to random drops, though this could just be my internet, but they're much more active than I expected, so that's a plus. I have yet to see any roleplaying either, which is another bonus. I personally have nothing against it, I myself have done it on Primal Carnage, but on a game like this there's no excuse for it. The biggest worry I have now is balance. While the majority of the classes seem to be somewhat balanced, I'm worried the Puertosaurus is too strong. I'll have to get a group of T. rex's together to try hunting one and see if it's possible to kill it, but if not that seems to be something to be worried about if everyone just goes Puerto.

As for planned features, I am hesitent on the ideas of skill tree and strains, but I'll turn a blind eye on them for now since we know very little about them. I am curious about the human factions and how they'll play out, especially cannibals. The thing I'm most excited about is the new animals coming. We already have Titanoboa, Queztalcoatlus, Dilophosaurus, Spinosaurus, Therizinosaurus, Deinonychus, Megaraptor, Tupandactylus, Helicoprion/Parahelicoprion, Diabloceratops, and Acrocanthosaurus as confirmed animals, and it's heavily hinted that we well get Diplodicus as well, in addition to some for of crocodilian and stegosaurid. That's quite the list, 15 total, in addition to the 6 we already have, for a grand total of 21 genus's.

All in all, the current state of the game is really fun if your patient. I can look back the admited lack of content and annoying bugs as the game is playable. They've done alot to try and smooth it out since launch, with 5 patches alrealy released, which is doing wonders for my confidence in the dev's. Is the game perfect? Far from it. Is it worth trying in it's current state? That depends. I'll admit $20 is a high asking price for it, so if you wanna get it best either doing so now while it's on sale or waiting for more content. But it is fun and I see good things in it's future.


Final verdict NA/5 ( Holding my rating untill some more cotent comes out.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was skeptical about this game at first, and to a degree I still am, but it is only fair to try a game for oneself before forming an official opinion on it.

Dinosaur gamers have been met with more disappointments than not in previous years. Primal Carnage, for example, which promised to be a competitive shooter with a serious tone, is little more than a clutter of roleplay and modded servers now. And don't even get me started on the Orion... Series? (More like one terrible apology after another.) Also, The Stomping Land, which is in fact where The Isle repurposed its dinosaur models from after that game utterly failed.

Being that The Isle is early access, I can only compare what the game offers now to what it promises. I already have some concerns about it, such as an overload of skins. This concerns me because Primal Carnage seemed more concerned with aesthetics than gameplay, and it resulted in a terribly balanced game that, as aforementioned, resulted in little more than a clutter of roleplay and modded servers. However, it is my understanding that at least one and maybe a few developers who worked on Primal Carnage are involved with The Isle, and so while this might sound scary, there is another way to look at this: they realized that roleplay and mods are what dinosaur gamers want! We don't necessarily want to run around getting killed by humans--or conversely run around as humans killing dinosaurs--all the time, and that was the mistake Primal Carnage made, and Orion too for that matter (although Orion made far many more mistakes than just that, so I admit it's a cheap comparison). All we want is just to be a dinosaur. Is that too much to ask for?

According to The Isle, no, it is not too much to ask for! In the game's current state, The Isle provides players with the opportunity to herd/pack, eat, drink, fight, and explore as one of several dinosaurs in landscapes that even in early access are already beautiful. Even as simple as the game is now, I still can't get enough of it. It's like being in a dream, but instead of having to wrestle with insomnia all I have to do is boot up The Isle.

This in no way dismisses the responsibility of the developers to fulfill the promises they've made for this game. It is supposed to be so much more than it currently is, and obviously that's why it's merely early access, but I am recommending this game both for its current playability value and the potential it has. If you think the concerns I mentioned are worth holding off on this game, it's literally only $20. You spend more than that on one meal for two people at Taco Bell. The game is fun as is, so despite my concerns about its potential I still think it's worth checking out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is in early alpha so if you're expecting masses of content and gameplay, don't buy it.
Taking into consideration the fact that this game was released at the beginning of the month, the progress made is phenominal.
One thing I can say is unlike most pre-alpha games, I cannot see that this game has a lot of potential. Only reason I say this is because playing as a dinosaur, there is only so much that you can realistically do although I could be and most likely will be completely wrong. So far though, this game has had me hooked and I've played a good 4 hours of it only today.
I will now go through its many pros and some of its cons
-Pros-
Very realistic dinosaur models
Good dinosaur animations
Doesn't require a massively high spec PC to play at max graphics
Game is already far into development
Devs are very ambitious and active (so they have proven thus far)
There are quite a few options for dinosaurs to pick
-Cons-
Combat can be dodgy as dinosaurs cannot turn around quick enough to confront an attacker from behind
Limited and repetative attacks
Some dinosaurs can be over powered (for example the )
Some dino's are be under powered (The raptor and the T-rex)
-Changes I think should be made-
Raptors latching onto prey should be brought back
T-Rex should be made bigger
Raptor should have a bit more health
Raptor should deal more damage
-Things I think should be added-
Flying dinosaurs
Additional attacks (bind scroll wheel to a kick attack)
Making nests
Mating
Clans/Packs/Herds (with a highlighted name above the dino to signal what pack it is in)
Overall this game is awesome and I hope the devs continue their hard work! :)

The game ooks amazing. If you can play it with everything maxed that is. Otherwise a sub-10 fps gaming experience will be what you can expect and it is not fun. The game has a LLLOOONNNGGG ways o go in that respect. Its an early access game so obviously there isn't much to it at all. The lack of any real gameplay gets real old real fast. Not so much when its not just you but even being with a group of players you can only talk to some of them because of the only chat option is species only which really took the game down a notch for me honestly. This game has a lot of potential though in that many, many, many extinct creatures will be brought into this game over the years. Plus humans are in the near future as well as these mutant Orc looking things.

That being said...

Many of the devs are not capable of acting in a professional manner towards their playerbase. I've seen quite a few dev streams, seen many screenshots, read many reviews and read many posts on both forums. They are quite rude and admit to being trolls. They more specifically openly make fun of players with physical and mental disabilites(especially autism) as well as using the f word when referring to gay players. Anyone who says they are just joking around when making such statements clearly don't know the history of these individuals. Oh and they love handing out lifetime forum and game bans for what pretty much any normal person would classify as a minor offence committed either ingame or on the forums. That is the opposite of proper behavior and actions of a developer indie or not. Disgusting.

If the latter wasn't true then I would totally recommend this game. But obviously MANY people know otherwise from their own firsthand experience. And as said above there is a lot good about the actual game itself(well eventually at least) but in this case the latter of course has to outweigh the former.

So, as long as certain people are still able to interact with this community I can not morally or ethically recommend this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Read my gameplay experiences at the bottom.


The Isle, at it's current state, is pretty awesome! Though you can say there isn't any solid/structured gameplay at the moment, it still is fun. It's especially relly fun when you find a player and you slowly stalk them awaiting the perfect time to ambush them and go for the kill.

Things to note that the game currently has as of writing this review:

-Very good, fluid, and realistic dinosaur animation and movement
-Different dinosaurs to play as, along with multiple skins to choose from
-A very large map to explore
-AI/NPCs that roam the map. Currently the AI is super basic, but it will be greatly improved soon
-Day/Night cycle
-Structures around the map that one could explore
-In-Game chat
-Awesome sounds for dinosaurs
- Alot more

For information on future content, view the Early Access info/FAQ page. It's ontop of the buy option.

The devs are very active and are always communicating with the community. The demo had constant updates, sometimes multiple per day, the EA version will be the same;especially now since they have a way to fund their game. They even host twitch streams of the development and progress of the game which is an awesome thing, and is a cool oppertunity to get further involved with the project.

Should you get this game?

That question depends on you.

Right now the game is still very early in development, so don't expect the game to have a ton of content. So buy this game if you wish to help FUND the project and SUPPORT the devs, and to HELP TEST the game out as it develops.

If you are not satisfied, wait a few weeks or months and come back to check on the progress.

Will the developers abandon this project?
NO THEY WILL NOT! After their kickstarter failed, the devs continued to develop the game even though they were broke. They spent countless hours working on the game to make it a success and get it to where it is now. Their effort is evidence that they will do whatever it takes to make sure that this game succeeds.

Edit:

So now I played for a few hours and had alot of fun as a rex. The map is really big so it was easy to find players, but I came across about 12 in around an hour. Alot of them I spotted and slowly hunted them until I was able to ambush them and kill em >:D . I later found a rex pack and was able to kill all but 1. So far the game has been really fun! Alot of interesting things around the map to explore and see.

Edit 2:

Wow I just had a ton of fun.

There's a faction/conquest war going on between Rexes, Raptors, and Herbivores in the NY server.

Each specie have started packs, and taking over numerous outposts throughout the game, and claiming it as their territory.

There was a giant raptor pack at this one outpost (we called it the Capital). Literally any intruder got decimated. Until, soon enough, the Rexes began an uprising. Soon enough, the majority of the pack got killed from a TRex ambush. Then, a bigger ambush took place. The capital was lost, that place became Rex territory,

Then there was a back and forth between control of the outpost, but in the end the raptors found a new home.

The Rexes had, earlierl, taken over the first and original raptor outpost (seperate from capital). So rexes and raptors became #1 enemies.

So the conquest wars continued and are most likely still going on right now.

This game currently doesn't have any structured/solid gameplay. But when the players make up their own gameplay, then things get very interesting.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well colour me surprised. This game is actually pretty decent.

It is very barebones at the moment, as the most you can really do is just wander around and devour everything in your sight, which has yet to become boring.

Obviously it's going to be a long road ahead for this game to really get on its feet, but so far so good I'd say. The dinosaurs are modelled and animated beautifully, and the map itself is a fantastic marvel to explore. You'll find yourself admiring scenery often. I do wish the jungles were a little more dense to allow for better ambushing for the predators, but that's a minor nitpick.

The optimization is very good, much better than other early access games (looking at you ARK), I have a vegetable of a computer and it's able to run this game very smoothly, lag free, and I have not experienced a crash as of yet.

The problems are mostly minor, but they're there. Carnivores run rampant on the map. Herbivores are for the most part powerless against the predatory dinosaurs. Especially the Rex, who appears to be the most OP at the moment. A formidable herbivore is something that's desperately needed. A ceratopsian or an ankylosaur would be stellar. The Carnotaurus also seems rather lacking, it just appears to be a slightly faster much weaker version of the Rex.

The biggest problem I see with the game in its current state is the price tag. It's not worth 20$, I'm just gonna flat out say it. On a good day you can buy fully finished games with dozens of hours of content for 20$.

As it stands this is a must have for dinosaur fans, although anyone who's not a hardcore reptilian fanatic is probably going to find themselves bored with the game in its current state. Aside from just being a dinosaur, (which is incredibly cool don't get me wrong) there's not really much game yet.

Can't wait to see what's in store.

Really sorry to say, but I've had to edit my review on this game.

In the recent months they have shown some very real progress and have pumped out some seriously cool updates, and really seem to be on top of development. The game has become quite a lot more enjoyable with the addition of new gameplay mechanics and new playable species.

However they had to ruin any chance of praise by the repugnant treatment of one of the developers, who they are, amongst other things, refusing to pay. I can not, and will not support developers with such disgraceful practices.

Devs get your act together and fix this problem. This is exactly what killed the Stomping Land, and what will get you killed too.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have to say its very easy to become taken in by this game despite its early stages! At the point of this review, the game is but a shadow of what it has promised to become, but already I find myself coming back for more! Skulking around 'The Isle', as one of the creatures that the game currently contains, offers immersion within a prehistoric world that to me, is unrivalled. Want to explore as one of the Isles smaller herbivore dinosaurs like the Gallimimus? You can do that. Fancy teaming up with a group of friends as a pack of raptors and stalking other players together planning the best oppurtunity for a take down? Go crazy. More of a lone wolf who's looking to dominate all of the other players as the massive T-rex? Why not. Although right now the game doesn't have heaps of options in terms of things to do, for what it does right now, it does it very well, with a strong feel of immersion and survival, mixed with perhaps the PVP of games like Primal carnage, and I always find myself completely consumed into the world! If you are expecting a fully polished game with tons of options then maybe right now this is not the game for you, but if you're cool with the concept of early access and enjoy other games, such as Primal Carnage, or Ark, then this is certainly one to check out!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tired of playing dinosaurs games where you do everything except play as a dinosaur? then The Isle is here for you. one of the few dinosaur games in the world that allows you to play as a dino, The Isle allows you to take control of a large selection of prehistoric animals from the T-Rex, to Triceratops, all the way down Gallimimus. explore a world designed to kill you as you compete with other players who want to survive as much as you do.

One thing you should know is that this game is still in development so there is still much that has not been finished yet. the game will have a large selection of dinosaurs to choose from once they are all finished. there will even be Humans in this game, both modern day man using guns and tribal men native to the island. both will be able to capture and tame dinosaurs. but Humans have not been added yet so you will not be able to play as them right now. but when they are added, it'll be a fun experience to feel like you're playing The Lost World: Jurassic Park. but playing as the Humans will be optional so one day you could be Online and run into your friend who's playing as a dinosaur while you're a Human. awesome right? :D

The game is open world free roam like Skyrim and Fallout. go any where you want when ever you want. but just to let you know there is no map and so you have to read coordinates to find your way around or else you're going to get lost. from what I understand, the Humans will have maps and even a selection of several vehicles to travel around the island quickly. from trucks, helicopters, and even military weapons. traveling on foot will create less noise to attract dinosaurs but you'll be vulnerable and easily killed. so you need to think before you leave your camp into the jungle or else you'll be an easy target for those who are playing as dinosaurs.

There are no aliens, dragons, or any magical creatures in this game. this is just straight up dinosaurs on a dinosaur island. but there will be something called, The Strains" that will be added in the future. I haven't seen much info on them
date: but from what I hear they are supposed to be mutated dinosaurs like the ones from Dino Crisis 3. so there will be fictional creatures in the future.\n\nThere will be something called a Progression System added sometime in the future that allows you to level up the dinosaur you're playing as. increase your health
hoursPlayed: and stamina until you're top of the food chain as the apex.\n\nOnce all dinosaurs have been finished

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just bought this game today and I've had a ton of fun playing it so far.

The gameplay so far is admittedly very simple. You walk around, press E to eat/drink, press F to roar, and left click to attack. There's just something about the fact that you're walking around, eating and roaring as a DINOSAUR. The animations are beautiful and smooth, which definitely makes the experience more enjoyable. There's no real goal, other than to explore, meet people, maybe attack some things, maybe run away from things.

There are problems with the game, of course. It's early access, and that's accepted. As a raptor, sometimes you get stuck in the pounce" position and you're sliding around on your tail with your little claws up in the air as you grin as everyone you pass. The puertasaurus definitely has some work that's needed

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access Game	A lot of people have trouble buying an early access game because they are afraid it wont be finished and I have no doubts this game will be finished. The Devs are working hard and the general dev has put his heart and soul into this and seeing what his hard work has made is amazing. Updates are regular and if you want to connect with more people before buying the game feel free to go and watch the developement on Twitch [https://www.twitch.tv/thedondi/profile]

Dinosaurs	The models in The Isle are fantastic to say the least. A few of them were purchased from the Stomping Land but other than that they are all original. Animations are smooth (even on my crappy laptop) and really bring these prehistoric creatures to life. A few people complain that there are not enough dinosaurs however (I don't like using this excuse) this game is in early access and more are to come.

Multiplayer	The multiplayer is a HUGE aspect to The Isle, because it is only multiplayer (duh). The community is great with its share of bad apples but if you can over look that then you are golden! Most people will jump to help a new player and are always up to meet up and hunt or graze together but be wary as a carnivore, you may not mean any harm to a herb when trying to get to water but they tend to be a bit overprotective and many (sadly) most will attempt to kill you.

Developers	I'm going to clear any worries you have about the devs. When people say they don't recommend The Isle it's mostly because of the unprofessional" developers and how they treat the players. I agree they could treat people with a little more respect but we can also adapt to that by growing thicker skins. They are also very unprofessional but this is an indie game created by a rag-tag team of people who do what they do because they love it. There is a trade off to having a personal connection to the team and not. If you do not fallow the teams developement through Twitch and stay on the forums you will find a more professional side of the devs (unless you ask a something asked 100 times already) but if you go on Twitch and have the ability to play on a server with them you will find they are more open and tend to fool around more. It's up to you how you want to portray them but if you can't enjoy the game because you can't handle a little heat then this is not the game for you.

System Requirements	I will say this game needs more than your average laptop can handle. Despite that fact I play it on a laptop because im cheap and love the game too much to let a little lag and low settings to ruin my day. Understand that if you buy this game and use an everyday computer you will never get the most out of it and don't complain that it isn't optimized enough because trust me they have optimized the ♥♥♥♥ out of it. Too many people come on and say something about how they can't play the game properly because one reason or another but we all have this struggle so please keep it to your self (I mean this in the nicest of ways).

Summary	The Isle is a good game and this review turned more into a rant than anything but I hope it helped. If you have any questions feel free to slide into my DMs."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I feel I should have pointed this out in the original posting: This review is by no means set in stone. Should changes be made, either positive or negative, they will most likely be mentioned in this review.

As amazing as this game is, and with all the potential it has....I just can't get past the community. The Devs, the players, they're all such toxic, immature, degenerates that it truely makes me not enjoy playing this game. I only have ~50 hours in the game, and I'm already so turned off by the community, I'm considering dropping this game until it makes it out of early release.

That being said, for a fairly new E.A. title, the game itself isn't too bad. Yes, there's the usual array of assorted bugs of varying type and sevarity that's expected with early access. But once you get past those, the game really is pretty amazing, and again....so much potential!

Final two cents: If you can deal with a plethora of jack-asses, children, trolls, and gaggles of griefers who don't care who they target....then by all means, please support this game. If you can't deal with the genral ♥♥♥♥♥♥ness of humans with the power of internet annonymity, then avoid this till it's further into development. If at all.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game! One of my favorite games on steam at the momment.

The isle is an early access open world survival game where you play as a dinosaur (humans and pterosaurs will be added as well).  The Isle is an amazing game if you are a paleonerd (such as myself) because The Isle's dinosaurs are pretty accurate and featherd. It's nice to see a game that actually cares about dinosaurs...( Ark: Survival Evolved )

The Isle's gameplay can be fun and fast paced and boring and slow paced, depending on how many people is on the server and what creature you choose to play as. The gameplay is great but can be clumpsy at certain times. But keep in mind that this is an early access game, so there will be many changes in the future.

The graphics are semi-good in my opinion. There are a few graphical glitches here and there that will probably be patched in the future. The game runs pretty well, at least on a GeForce GTX 780.

I really reccomend this game if you love dinosaurs and  open world survival.


(Btw the game looks better than it shows in the trailer on steam)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I usually run around as a TRex....because well, it's a T-Friggin-Rex! I try to help my fellow dino. I've helped protect long necks and I'm typically a good guy. I was playing last night though and no one was spawning near me. As a dino, you have to eat and drink to stay alive. Finally two more T-Rexes came around and so we grouped up and it was great fun. As we walked around trying to find food my food meter kept getting brighter and brighter...I was starving.

So I made a choice. I fell the back of the pack and very quickly attacked the TRex at the rear, killing him in just a few hits. Before the front one could figure out what I did, I pounced on him. I felt bad eating them but my food meter was fixed. I was happy. I was alive.

I give this game a 4/5. I'd eat my friends again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hold off on getting this game. The game is bare bones, containing nothing but a few dinos (7 of them), the ability to kill/hurt each other, and a simple hunger/thirst system. Things are slowly being added to the game, but I honestly would not count on things getting very far. The biggest problems with the game isn't with the game itself, but with the people involved with it. The devs (mostly the lead one) has made some poor decisions and they do not think highly of their consumers. Even the ones who fiercely defend them. I have a feeling that the game could be abandoned at some point, especially at the current rate things are going. Support at your own risk.

I'll keep watching this game to see if anything improves.

**EDIT 2/17/2016**
I meant to do this earlier. The skins are back in. However, this gives a sense of the kind of ride this project is in for. Personal squabbles and team in-fighting can affect this game. I've also noticed some of the community" is starting to mimic some of the dev's behavior. Not a good sign.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is so fun even this far in development where not even half of the planned content has been added yet, but still manages to keep my attention for hours at a time! The game is actually quite addictive and one of the unique games that lets you play and survive as a dinosaur. Now, i'm a picky person when it comes to dinosaur games and this game is just everything i've wanted from a game like this. This game is actually quite unique so far and still has lots of potential as much is planned for the future. I would really recommend this game even at this state of Early Access. This game is fun and you can play as pretty much all the dinosaurs you loved as a child and more, as well as being able to choose from different factions to be added such as the Mercs and the Cannibals including the Dinosaurs. All factions play differently and require different techniques to survive. I also love the challenge of this game as there are no tutorials and no hints/tips and this feature might also encourage you to socialise with other players to ask what to do. Overall I don't have any major bad things to say about this game and would DEFINITELY recommend the game.
