reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty great idea, and breath-taking models. They do appear to be straying away from the modern bird-like models however, and they are now starting to look more like they do in Jurassic Park (Although that isn't exactly a bad thing). Game seems to run fine for me, and its a fun experience. Although the game does currently have MANY major flaws.

1: Servers
Massive Multiplayer games like these need good servers, and when you seem to crash out of you're game every 30-40 minutes it just ruins the fun you and your friends are having. Not to mention that many of ther servers are flat out dead, and with only about 30 to choose from, you will more often then not find yourself in one with only 10 people because the main servers are full with around 50-70 players capped.

2: Map
The map FEELS small. I have yet to find how small it really is, but I always spawn next to the wall (Which is just a drop off into nothing). This coupled with the very dense hills you traverse through, make it so you can never see any mountains in front of you, so the map just appears to end almost everywhere. This makes the game feel VERY small. Although the Misty Vally map is a perfect polar opposite of this, with plateaus and deep valleys, filled with fog and well mist, make the map feel open and spacious. I hope to see later maps go follow this example, or better yet, just try to make the current maps feel more open.

3: Chat
When you choose a dinosaur, your chat box is now exclusive to that type of dinosaur, and you can't see the other chat. This is bad in its own ways, but mainly it makes the game feel very empty. I can see where they are coming from with this, making it so you and other species can't communicate with one another and give away position. I think that instead of locking my species, they could lock it by Carnivore and Herbivore. This way, the game is still keeping the the division between species well enough that herds can't be exposed by others in the group, and the chat can be more easily used between these groups.

Thats about all I can think of off the top of my head, I didn't talk about anything like the camera, or ping issues (Beside Servers) because those will al be fixed in due time. I would just hope to see more design" being placed into gameplay and immersion instead of pumping out new dinosaurs every other week.

Have these be fixed
date: and the final product be as smooth as I hope it becomes I would give it a 7 or 8/10. I just ♥♥♥♥ing love dinosaurs.\n\nAlthough as the game is currently I would give it a 5/10."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all this game is great and understand its still being developed (early access) as im a dev myself, but there needs to be more options added to it instead of just adding dinosaurs.

1.Spawn protection from spawn campers/killers that ruin the game (Server Option)
Hint: No Killing/Damage can be inflicted for a short time (Duration timer)

2.Species Crossfire turned off (Server Option)
Hint: Cant Attack your own kind

3.Herbivores/Carnivores Crossfire off (Server Option)
Hint: Herbivores cant attack each other / Carnivores cant attack each other

4.Pack Party Groups
Hint: Hover the Crosshair on a Dino Press a key to invite to pack, invitation is send to that player and they have to hit a key to accept it or another key to decline it. Press another key to leave the pack. Blue Name Templates are shown when in pack

5. Pack Party Group Crossfire (Server Option)
Hint: Able to kill each other in Packs

6.Global and Species/Pack Chat Channels
Hint: Global: can chat with everyone, Species:Can only talk in chat with your own kind and Pack Chat Channel: talk to anyone in the pack (pack chat channel replaces your species chat when invited) Global and Species/pack chat are switchable with a key press


I'm seeing to many people killing everything they see which is ruining the game for everyone to enjoy/test the early access

Herbivores being killed in the crossfire or other Herbivores killing each other same with the Carnivores

Even tho i love the game , its fun. But if your in a server with people that will kill everything they see, you get really annoyed. Which i only play on our own hosted server with mates to avoid what i mentioned above

This game is really bad, im sorry but its true. This game may have some cool models but the pros stop around there. First lets start with the community and the players. reviewText:
Early Access Review

At this point in the game's development, Overrall I would not recomend buying this game until more development has been done. I was excited because alot of videos gave me the idea of being able to become part of packs/herds with friends, you know a really cool dinosaur experience. The only problem is that sometimes you both spawn at opposite ends of the map. Playing the game gets repetitive and boring after a while, you just walk around and eat or drink. All I can say is just wait, I have expectations for this game and what they promise sounds awesome. I just hope it doesn't end up like the Stomping Land, where it might disappear completely. I plan to edit this review to match my current opinion of this game.

Pros:
-Dinosaurs
-Animations are awesome
-Herding/packing up with friends or even with strangers is alot of fun

Cons:
-Combat system is lackluster (As expected its Early Access game).
-The community is the worst, its overflowing with all types of unsavory people.
-Map size makes it a little difficult to group up with friends

Date of this review is April 26th, at 12:36 am. This is an early access review

The isle is an open world dinosaur game where you can currently play for a variety of both herbivorous and carnivorous dinosaurs. Now at the moment, the only real gameplay is to spawn, wander around, and eventually die. You may say to yourself but isnt that most survival games
recommended: but what this game currently lacks is not rules
hoursPlayed: but a consequence for death. You simply die and choose a new dino to spawn as. Yes
voteText: you're spawned in some random point on the map but other that you lose NOTHING. So a lot of players will just kos
helpfulPercent: gang up on random people
votesHelpful: and just cause a general bad time.\nYes

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game gets ♥♥♥♥♥ier & ♥♥♥♥♥ier with every update. Love, Dinosaur Loving Fool

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where to start? This game has so many flaws I could write an entire essay about the gameplay, the community, the devs, and other things. So where is the best place to start? Clearly most reviews like to start off with the basic stuff such as the gameplay so let's start there. I do notice this is a Early Access game, but honestly, its been out for nearly four months and this is all we have so far.
The gameplay is horrific. Bugs are everywhere. Flying dead dinos along with annoying bugged hit boxes as well as texture loading problems. The graphics are alright, some stuff seems as if little attention was put into it such as some of the foliage. Also from time to time the textures will not load in which causes your enjoyment of the game to dwindle entirely. Honestly, I've seen two pixel games that are better then the Isle. The biggest weakness of this game is the fact that there is no purpose to it, you simply walk around as a dino and kill stuff, not very fun. People may have bought this game hoping that they could mate with other dinos and raise there babies, because that's what dinos do, and they also try to live. Instead, you are stuck with everything around you wanting to kill you, no matter if it is a tiny diablo or a freaking puerta. Like what the h***, herbivores hunting down and killing predators isn't normal? So you buy this game to enjoy being the top predator of the food chain, but instead you're lying dead in a pile of diablo s***. Because logic apparently. I could go on for days but instead let's move onto the dinos.
You'll be terribly disappointed to hear that the herbivores are the strongest dinos in the game, rex doesn't even make the top 3rd spot. So much for King of the Dinos, more like King of the Dryos. Since we are on the topic of rex let's move into more detail. Rex has a lot of issues, there are lots of hitbox bugs when trying to attack another rex which could get you killed in turn. Most of the time you think you have the upper hand but then the game decides you suck and let's the other player kill you somehow, even though you may have been behind it and bit it three times, it just tells you to go f*** yourself. It gets extremely frustrating because you know you have a good ping and it isn't the lag but instead it's the game itself that caused your demise. Onto the next cool dino, the allosaurus! It's basically sh**, the turning radius is about the same as a Shunt which isn't good. Rex two shots it, basically it is weak and it takes more then 6 bites to kill a rex. All in all it is not something you want to be playing right now. So up next is the Carno. The carno is fun, it's fast and agile, it is mostly for smaller prey though it can kill a puerta because that's how bada** it really is. But puerta is tough, so you may have to die four of five times before you kill the large motherf*****. Though carno isn't strong enough for a rex since the rex can turn 360 degrees with no problems and two shot the carno. For our last carnivore we have the austroraptor. It is small and quick, it isn't exactly good at killing anything, I've seen very skilled players kill larger dinos but mostly you can only kill dryos and gallis, that's about it, have fun. With all the carnivores done let us move onto the overpowered dinos who rule The Isle, the herbivores. First up we have our top predator, the Puerta! This fata** is the toughest thing you will ever see, these large dinos go on mad killing sprees killing up to 20 dinos in a single life. With so much health it can survive for a long time, but not defending itself, no instead these dinos are blood thirsty killers, sometimes they are friendly to other herbivores, sometimes not. These large beasts rule the world without a doubt. For our next extremely tough dino is the Stegosaurus. These things can kill a rex in two swipes of its tail that can bend like a snakes back. Don't question the devs because that's their logic. Honestly, you need about two to three rexes to take down one stego, it's not worth the trouble since most stegos hunt down carnivores to kill and feed from. They have been notoriously labeled, Nazi's." As for our Shungtungasaurs they have recently been nerfed so they don't pose much of a threat except to every carnivore. These fatties don't do a whole lot
date: they just stomp and eat stuff
recommended: like the stegos they will chase after carnivores from time to time which gets really old seeing all these herbivores chasing carnivores. Next we have Theri
hoursPlayed: it is a cute bird that has nice long claws which it doesn't use all that much because it is usually dead before it does. They have a slow turning speed as well as a slower run from that of a galli. Mostly these things go after carnos and raptors. As I was saying about Gallis
voteText: these things are the fastest thing in the game (besides quetz that isn't out yet). They can kill a rex easily if they get behind it first

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI asked in discussions for opinions from other players about what attracts them about this game. What a got was mocking comments from the developer himself. I bought the game for 2 hours and refunded it. All the players were literally just laying around at the watering hole. Literally doing nothing for hours. I would imagine a croc sunbathing sim would be just as exciting. Ultimately, the developer mock customers and potential customers, the gameplay is boring, and you have to deal with camera having a seizure every time you're on uneven ground (which is all the time). Also, be ready to break your legs and become immobile for hours from poor textures near hills. This game dawns the typical early access, very small and un-noteworthy updates. No real game improvements, bare bones of a game. Obviously from the mostly positive reviews, some people like this game. For everyone else, don’t bother.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Though I realize this game is EA I dont see how it can be priced so high. The concept sounds great but there is many issues with game play.

1. The T-Rex can kill almost any dino in one bite. Can you say OP?
2. When attacking totally no way of knowing if you are doing anything. All you do is smash your mouse button and hope.
3. There is no HUD yet which makes it hard to know if you are even loosing a fight till you are dead.
4. Everyone seems to enter the game in the same places. So it is spawn in get eaten or eat someone. Eventually someone eats you!! This could be cool but just feels boring.

I will still follow the game and at some point in the future I may buy it again. Right now feels like it should cost a lot less as they test the simple things they have in right now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

SERIOUS GAME FANS.. AVOID THIS AT ALL COSTS!  This is nothing more then an attempt to fund a game IDEA that is less then 10% complete at it's Early Access launch.  This should be on KickStarter, not here.

Un-Edited Real Time Gameplay On a 60+ Player Server:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=obCY6aWGTkM

- Okay, can't play more then 3 minutes without getting disconnected from any sever I connect to with this error in red in the upper left:  Error: PendingConnectionFailure Server: false

- Secondly, The maps are obviously huge and look great.. but with only a few players on each server, how the hell are we ever supposed to find each other to battle?

- Third, I killed a small dino (AI controlled) but then couldn't eat him even though I was hungry.  Spammed E 1000 times while moving all over and around the corpse, never did eat.

- Fourth, clipping issues galore (rocks and trees)

- Five.. a 40 ton t-rex just walks on water?  Come on guys, I know this is EA but FFS

- Six, Why do some dinos have two attacks and some only get the left mouse button attack?  I assume its the heavier dinos that can't jump get the two attacks with both mouse buttons and the dinos that can jump only get one?  Still, this is awkward

- Seven, I seen a huge plant eating dino again AI controlled and I was one the smaller ones that came up to its knees, if that.  So I attacked its legs 3,000 times to see it was useless.

- Eight, Voice chat doesn't work

- Nine, sliding off mountains 2,000 feet high even with a t-rex does no damage, no falling animations, just horrible.

- Ten, not nearly enough blood to indicate if your bites or succeeding or not.

- Eleven, everytime I launch the game... I have to reset my graphics settings over again.  Ugh.

- I got excited the first time i saw little outposts with buildings and jeeps, thought maybe I could have some fun destroying them but nope, all I could do was more awkward clipping thru them!  YAY!

The developers say they have been working hard on this game for a year now, and have admitted that all the dinosuar models have been acquired from The Stomping Lands".  The idea is cool
date: but right now that's all this game is right now is just ideas.  There is nothing to do here except run around
hoursPlayed: trees
voteText:
and other dinosaurs until you get bored or get another network error.

Beasts of Prey at its bug fest launch in early access was about 50 times more "fun" then this is right now.

If it took the developers a year of hard work to get this far
helpfulPercent: then check back in about seven more years and maybe it will be 50% complete.\n\nI understand the developers need funding to work on something like this
votesHelpful: but Steam early access is NOT what that is for.  You aren't supposed to be charging full price for a game 10% complete.  This is what KickStarter is for
votesTotal:
not Steam early access.

The fact this this game has 10 of 11 reviews showing postives right now is exactly why Steam reviews CANNOT be trusted.

Devs.. I like your ideas for this
votesFunny: but take this to KickStarter and I personally will help fund this if you need money as you say.  But here on Steam
commentsCount: this is not what early access is for.  Here I am and will request an immediate refund
column16: which is exactly what everyone should do when a game is launched this early in development on Steam instead of giving positive BS reviews based on nothing but blind faith alone."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So uh
i do not know what to say so here is a taco recipe instead, i was going to Batter up a pancake recipe but those are over done



INGREDIENTS
• 2 pounds mahi mahi (skinned, boned and cleaned) cut into 1-ounce strips
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 3 eggs, lightly beaten
• 4 tablespoons water
• 2 cups panko bread crumbs
• Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
• Vegetable oil, for frying
• 1/2 head savoy cabbage, finely shredded
• 1 bunch cilantro, leaves picked
• 1 bunch chives, chopped
• 3 limes, cut into wedges for garnish
PINK CHILE MAYONNAISE:
•	1 cup sour cream
•	1 cup mayonnaise
•	3 chipotles in adobo, plus 2 tablespoons of adobo sauce
•	1/2 lemon, juiced
•	Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
MANGO-RADISH SALSA:
•	2 limes
•	2 mangoes, diced
•	4 to 5 red radishes, diced
•	1 red onion, diced
•	1 tablespoon chili powder
•	1/2 bunch fresh cilantro, leaves chopped
•	1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
•	Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
DIRECTIONS
Prepare the fish. Cut the pieces of fish into 1-ounce strips. Set up abreading station of flour, lightly beaten eggs with water, and seasoned panko bread crumbs. Season all with salt and pepper.Dredge the pieces of fish in flour, egg then bread crumbs. Once all the fish is breaded deep-fry in small batches in (375 degrees F) oil.Drain on paper towels and season with salt. Keep warm until ready to serve.

Prepare the pink chile mayonnaise. Put the chipotles in a blenderand puree until smooth. Add the sour cream, mayonnaise, adobo sauce and lemon juice and continue to process until the mixture is consistent and creamy. Season with salt and pepper and refrigerate until ready to use.

Prepare the mango-radish salsa. Remove the peel and pith from the limes and cut between the membranes to remove the segments. Put these supremes" into a bowl and squeeze over the juice from the membranes. Add the remaining ingredients and mix. Season and refrigerate until ready to use. You can also place all of the ingredients into a food processor and puree for a smoother salsa.

To serve
date: set up the tacos "family-style". Assemble the fish in a pile on a plate; the pink chile mayonnaise in a bowl; and mango-radish salsa in another. Set a pile of shredded savoy cabbage
hoursPlayed: chopped chives and lime wedges next to the fish. Toast the corn tortillas lightly over an open flame (on your stove top) and serve."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My first review of the game was negative, because I hadn't poured enough playtime in it. Now that I have more than 200hrs in the game, I think I might be more able to write a decent review.

So, first of all, that game is in early access, that's why my review is totally assumed as a temporary" review
date:
that may change with time. Everything that I might say in there is related to the game in it's 0.89 version.

Pros :
-A dev team clearly involved in its project
recommended: doing livestreams and stuff to stay close to the community.\n-Beautiful textures
hoursPlayed: for the environments and the Dinos
voteText: knowing that the 3D models could be worth thousands dollars each is pretty astonishing.\n-Realism is a keyword for that game\n-No abused balancing
helpfulPercent:
no OP-Rex.

Cons :
-A dev team that likes to keep mystery about future patches. You don't know what'll be next.
-Irregular patch parutions
votesHelpful: you can wait 2 days before having a huge patch
votesTotal: and you can also wait months before seeing something that have been announced a while ago (Quetzalcoatlus
votesFunny: that is even in the storepage screens
commentsCount: but not in game
column16: despite it have been announced since 0.24 patch
column17: something like that).\n-A community populated by children. That game should be available for 18+ only
column18: that's horrible seeing kids everywhere
column19: on community forums or even ingame :\n-Cancerous behaviours ingame : Kids that kills everything on sight because they're a mighty rex; other carnivores that threathen you if you try to eat their herb friend.... I agree that every player can have his playstyle
column20: but some of them are simply ruining the fun for others.\n-Some basic issues reported by the community
column21: but not being worked on by the dev team. I take for exemple the recent issues about ghost trees
column22: or even the balance problem of Therizinosaurus.\n\nTo conclude
column23: seeing that the majority of negative points aren't directly linked to the dev team or the game directly
column24: I give a 7/10 to the game for it's brilliant efforts. And also for JP nostalgia."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo being an ♥♥♥ eater I have to say I thought this game would be just some generic survival game but with dinosaurs, but as it turns out this game is actually really fun! It feels more like survival of the fittest than just surviving. (Even though this game's ecosystem is a little unbalanced by all the over powered herbivores) 8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Played as Triceratops with my friend.
-strolling through forest when we find small Diabloceratops
-we adopt him as our infant
-we spend many hours grazing, walking, and swimming as a family
-one stroll we find ourselves surrounded by 3 Tyrannosaurus and 5 Allosaurus
-friend tells me to run with infant
-whilst running friend charges all carnivores
-friend is killed, Diabloceratops lets out a roar as he sees his mother die
-we lived
10/10 would adopt Diabloceratops as infant again
